title: Sagmeister Azuero Earth Project font ID
content:
Anyone knows the font used?

Found it in my own font library

Font: 

 Foundry Gridnik 

Solved By: 

 [Myself](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414215739/http:/typophile.com/user/10733 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Azuero\_Logo\_Lores.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414215739/http:/typophile.com/files/Azuero_Logo_Lores.jpg) | 162.35 KB |
author: K.P.

comments.content:
Very familiar thin angular design. I thought I had it with House Industries United Sans Regular Thin [http://www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414215739/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection "http://www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection") or Octin College Thin [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/octin-college/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414215739/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/octin-college/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/octin-college/") but the J does not have the upper serif shown in your image and there are a few other minor differences.  
Don  
Edit  
After posting saw the self-solve of Foundry Gridnik.
